content:
• Tuesday, August 28, 2012
  • DY

    More on Dycom (NYSE:DY): FQ4 misses on all counts as revenue growth slowed. Gross margin...

    More on Dycom (NYSE:DY): FQ4 misses on all counts as revenue growth slowed. Gross margin narrowed to 20.7% from 21.3%. Shares -12% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • AMRN

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) says Phase 3 trials for vascepa met primary efficacy endpoints and...

    Amarin (NASDAQ:AMRN) says Phase 3 trials for vascepa met primary efficacy endpoints and significantly reduced median concentrations of large very-low-density lipoprotein, total LDL, small LDL and total high-density lipoprotein particles and reduced VLDL particle size in patients with very high triglycerides. Shares +1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • DY

    Dycom Industries (NYSE:DY): FQ4 EPS of $0.39 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $318M (+4.7% Y/Y)...

    Dycom Industries (NYSE:DY): FQ4 EPS of $0.39 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $318M (+4.7% Y/Y) misses by $5M. Shares -2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • VECO

    LED/solar equipment maker Veeco (VECO +3.7%) rallied into the close thanks to a positive note...

    LED/solar equipment maker Veeco (VECO +3.7%) rallied into the close thanks to a positive note from UBS. The firm believes 12 of Veeco's costly MaxBright systems could be used in a new LED manufacturing plant to be built by China's HC SemiTek, and estimates SemiTek's orders could contribute $0.51 in EPS over the next 3 years.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM
  • ZAGG

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +7.7%) roar higher in advance of a conference call scheduled by the company...

    Shares of Zagg (ZAGG +7.7%) roar higher in advance of a conference call scheduled by the company for 4:30 EST to discuss corporate objectives and management updates. Despite the buying frenzy, the chatter from traders is that the CC will be more of a rah-rah session than a news event. Decide for yourself here (webcast).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • ASEI

    X-ray inspection system maker American Science and Engineering (ASEI +8.4%) earns a new Buy...

    X-ray inspection system maker American Science and Engineering (ASEI +8.4%) earns a new Buy rating at Benchmark Company, which notes the disclosure of a $34M service and maintenance order from an undisclosed customer "gives us confidence that service revenue should be relatively steady" in fiscal 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +13%) is among today's top gainers on news that its California facility had begun...

    Molycorp (MCP +13%) is among today's top gainers on news that its California facility had begun to produce heavy rare-earth concentrate from freshly mined ore and is on track to achieve full Phase 1 production rates in Q4. But Paul Ausick reminds that by next year, the supply of rare earths will more than double the amount now on the market, and some companies are developing substitutes.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • TPR

    Shares of Coach (COH +1.1%) settle back down after a fat finger trade reportedly sent shares...

    Shares of Coach (COH +1.1%) settle back down after a fat finger trade reportedly sent shares spiking higher earlier in the afternoon.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 3 Comments
  • TNGO

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO -6.2%) has dived in afternoon trading thanks to a bearish report from The...

    Tangoe (OTC:TNGO -6.2%) has dived in afternoon trading thanks to a bearish report from The Street Sweeper. The site questions an "acquisition-driven growth strategy" that has helped the company meet estimates; notes Tangoe's CEO and CFO were targeted in a class-action suit related to accounting issues at a former employer; and criticizes the company's internal controls.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM | 3 Comments
  • PLCM

    Polycom (PLCM +4%) rallies after director Scott Mercer discloses he recently bought 25K shares....

    Polycom (PLCM +4%) rallies after director Scott Mercer discloses he recently bought 25K shares. Polycom has fallen sharply since last summer thanks to bad earnings news. IDC recently claimed the company gained videoconferencing share from Cisco (NASDAQ:CSCO) in Q2, but both firms have struggled to deal with the rise of software-centric upstarts such as Vidyo.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • AMPE

    Biotech's seem to be in the cross-hairs with Seeking Alpha pundits lately, as another...

    Biotech's seem to be in the cross-hairs with Seeking Alpha pundits lately, as another contributor goes on the hunt, this time taking aim at Ampio Pharmaceuticals (AMPE -3.4%). Short seller Adam Gefvert says that despite the hype surrounding its pipeline, it's not as impressive as it looks. Gefvert says much of the positive spin has come from stock pumpers skewing the importance of its pre-investigational NDA meetings. The drugs in question, Zertane and Ampion, have issues with generic competition as well as efficacy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • YELP

    Yelp (YELP -4.6%) is selling off ahead of tomorrow's lockup expiration; shares have now mostly...

    Yelp (YELP -4.6%) is selling off ahead of tomorrow's lockup expiration; shares have now mostly given back Friday's gains, and are down 29% from their Aug. 10 close. 52.7M shares will become eligible for sale tomorrow - by comparison, only 7.15M shares were sold in Yelp's IPO. VC investors hold large stakes in the company, as do chairman Max Levchin and CEO Jeremy Stoppelman.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM | 3 Comments
  • AAPL

    The next iPhone (NASDAQ:AAPL) won't feature an NFC chip, thinks AnandTech, after doing a...

    The next iPhone (NASDAQ:AAPL) won't feature an NFC chip, thinks AnandTech, after doing a technical analysis of the front assembly pictures that fueled speculation in this direction. The could be contributing to today's selloff in NXP (NXPI -2.9%), the early leader in the NFC chip market. Broadcom (BRCM) has also developed NFC chips, and plans to integrate the technology with its Wi-Fi/Bluetooth combo chips. (NFC challenges)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 4 Comments
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (APKT +5.8%) has steadily moved higher today. Possibly helping is a deal with...

    Acme Packet (APKT +5.8%) has steadily moved higher today. Possibly helping is a deal with wholesale U.S. carrier IBBS, which plans to deploy Acme's session border controllers to provide VoIP services. But with 16.5% of Acme's float shorted as of Aug. 15, and shares having been crushed over the last 12 months, it doesn't take much to produce a short-covering rally.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM
  • NOK

    Analysts question the idea Nokia (NOK -5.8%) will be a major beneficiary of the Apple-Samsung...

    Analysts question the idea Nokia (NOK -5.8%) will be a major beneficiary of the Apple-Samsung verdict. While expecting Windows Phone to get a lift from the ruling, Berenberg argues Nokia's upcoming Lumia phones still have "no chance" of competing against Apple and Samsung, and that the market is pricing in margin, ASP, and and market share improvements that might not arrive. MKM recommends buying October 3.5/2.5 or 3/2.5 put spreads.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 18 Comments
  • FSL

    Freescale (FSL -4.2%) slumps after UBS starts coverage with a Hold and $11.75 PT. The firm sees...

    Freescale (FSL -4.2%) slumps after UBS starts coverage with a Hold and $11.75 PT. The firm sees "few near-term catalysts," and considers the maker of analog chips and microcontrollers in the midst of a "multi-year turnaround." UBS likes the recent hiring of Texas Instruments exec Gregg Lowe as CEO, but thinks his impact won't be felt for 1-3 years. Goldman upgraded Freescale earlier this month as part of a bullish call on chip stocks.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • SFL

    Ship Finance (SFL +1.4%) moves up after posting a solid Q2 this morning, as net earnings rose...

    Ship Finance (SFL +1.4%) moves up after posting a solid Q2 this morning, as net earnings rose 48% amid a gain related to the termination of its Horizon Lines (OTCQB:HRZL) charters and contributions under its amended agreement with Frontline (NYSE:FRO). Dahlman Rose reiterates its Buy rating on the shares, albeit with the caveat that it expects redelivered vessels will serve as an overhang on the stock until they are rechartered longer term.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM
  • CDMO

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +24.7%) bounce back hard from yesterday's selloff on...

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +24.7%) bounce back hard from yesterday's selloff on the back of a negative Seeking Alpha article. The stock has been a momentum darling, up nearly 340% since the end of June, mainly on optimism over its cancer drug bavituximab, as defenders of the stock argue that recent Phase II studies show the doubling of tumor response rates, a 50% increase in median progression free survival, and trends toward significant improvement in median overall survival.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM | 2 Comments
  • CPRI

    Shares Michael Kors (KORS +5.1%) shoot higher on above-average volume. The retail and design...

    Shares Michael Kors (KORS +5.1%) shoot higher on above-average volume. The retail and design name could be getting a boost from the healthy earnings report and rosy outlook from PVH Corp. (PVH +4.5%) (earnings, CC).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • VWDRY

    Shares in Vestas Wind Systems (OTCPK:VWDRY +18.2%) surge after the wind-turbine maker confirms...

    Shares in Vestas Wind Systems (OTCPK:VWDRY +18.2%) surge after the wind-turbine maker confirms it’s in talks with Mitsubishi Heavy Industries over a strategic pact. Analysts believe any partnership between the two companies may emerge as a joint offshore-wind business which may erase lingering fears over Vestas’ cash position.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:52 AM
  • ADSK

    Autodesk (ADSK +3.2%) has bought some of the assets of Inforbix, a developer of cloud-based...

    Autodesk (ADSK +3.2%) has bought some of the assets of Inforbix, a developer of cloud-based product lifecycle management (PLM) software. Autodesk, which competes with PMTC and OTCPK:DASTY in the PLM space, plans to integrate Inforbix's technology within its cloud-based PLM360 suite, and has named Inforbix co-founder Oleg Shilovitsky its Senior Director of PLM and Data Management. Autodesk was crushed last week due to a poor FQ2 report (I, II, III).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • UAA

    Shares of Under Armour (UA +2.8%) and Nike (NKE +2.5%) run higher on enthusiasm that's been...

    Shares of Under Armour (UA +2.8%) and Nike (NKE +2.5%) run higher on enthusiasm that's been stirred up in part by a positive note from Stifel Nicolaus on Nike's sales trends. Momentum traders seem convinced the breakout is a sign of things to come for the pair of stocks.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM | 5 Comments
  • GMED

    Shares of Globus Medical (GMED +1%) trade higher after being initiated with a Buy at Goldman...

    Shares of Globus Medical (GMED +1%) trade higher after being initiated with a Buy at Goldman Sachs, Merrill Lynch BofA and Canaccord, and with an Outperform rating at Piper Jaffray. The stock has held up well since its IPO debut earlier this month, ending its first day +12% at $13.50 and holding steady ever since. More recently, the stock has begun to break above it's highs and head towards its original targeted IPO range, which was between $16-18.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • ASML

    In addition to downgrading KLA-Tencor, Deutsche has also cut rival ASML (ASML -3.1%) to Sell....

    In addition to downgrading KLA-Tencor, Deutsche has also cut rival ASML (ASML -3.1%) to Sell. The firm thinks 2013 Street estimates are too bullish in light of slowing foundry capex for cutting-edge chip manufacturing processes (Deutsche's forecast is 27% below consensus), and also believes "secular demand headwinds" (i.e. weak PC DRAM sales) will hurt memory capex.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM
  • PXD

    Pioneer Southwest Energy (PSE -2%) is cut to Sell from Neutral by UBS, which says the company's...

    Pioneer Southwest Energy (PSE -2%) is cut to Sell from Neutral by UBS, which says the company's relatively weak hedge profile, tight coverage ratio, limited distribution growth history, and sub-8% yield leave it cautious at current levels. Among E&P MLPs, the firm prefers Linn Energy (LINE) and Legacy Reserves (NASDAQ:LGCY).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 4 Comments
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS -4.6%) is cut to Sell from Neutral at UBS, with a $4 target price lowered from...

    AK Steel (AKS -4.6%) is cut to Sell from Neutral at UBS, with a $4 target price lowered from $5.50, as the firm believes most price support for carbon sheet has passed, with low cost imports and likely resolution of labor issues bringing pricing pressure. UBS views AKS as having the most downside risk in an environment with weaker pricing.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • QIHU

    Qihoo (QIHU -6.1%) is plunging in early trading, and another bearish column from SA's Richard N....

    Qihoo (QIHU -6.1%) is plunging in early trading, and another bearish column from SA's Richard N. Davis (previous) could be playing a role. Davis is critical of Qihoo's high valuation, and once more questions the validity of Qihoo's data about visits and clicks for its browser home page, as well as paid users for its online games. Others have also raised questions about Qihoo's stats. Qihoo took off last week thanks to a strong Q2 report and a decent early reception for its search engine.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM
  • LXK

    Lexmark (LXK +13.2%) soars after announcing plans to exit inkjet printing and step up its stock...

    Lexmark (LXK +13.2%) soars after announcing plans to exit inkjet printing and step up its stock buybacks. The company has had a rough year thanks to bad earnings news and poor industry demand. Interestingly, 3D printer vendors Stratasys (SSYS +2.4%) and 3D Systems (DDD +2%) are also trading higher, though Lexmark hadn't applied its inkjet tech to making 3D printers. H-P (NYSE:HPQ) and Xerox (NYSE:XRX) stand to gain inkjet share due to Lexmark's move.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 3 Comments
  • KHC

    Shares of Heinz (HNZ +2.2%) knock out a gain after the company discloses that it expects FQ1...

    Shares of Heinz (HNZ +2.2%) knock out a gain after the company discloses that it expects FQ1 earnings to increase by 10%. The company's annual meeting is in full swing (webcast), with other early highlights including a forecast for 5% organic growth and a promising outlook for emerging market revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:44 AM
  • MON

    Monsanto (MON -0.4%) signs a deal with Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +3.6%) to use the...

    Monsanto (MON -0.4%) signs a deal with Alnylam Pharmaceuticals (ALNY +3.6%) to use the biopharma's gene-silencing technology to improve its biopesticides. MON gains exclusive rights to use ALNY's platform technology and intellectual property; ALNY will receive $29M in upfront payments plus milestone payments and research funding.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharma (NASDAQ:CPRX) -21.1% premarket after announcing a direct public offering of 4M...

    Catalyst Pharma (NASDAQ:CPRX) -21.1% premarket after announcing a direct public offering of 4M shares of common stock and warrants to purchase 1.2M common shares. The aggregate offering price for each share and corresponding warrant is $1.50, resulting in gross proceeds of $6M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • KLAC

    KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC) -3.3% after Deutsche downgrades to Sell and lowers its PT to $44. The...

    KLA-Tencor (NASDAQ:KLAC) -3.3% after Deutsche downgrades to Sell and lowers its PT to $44. The firm sees rising yields for 28nm chips lowering demand for KLA's process control equipment, and thinks the company could see a "multi-quarter bookings slowdown in 2013." Deutsche also doesn't like KLA's "premium valuation" relative to peers (it trades at 13x estimated FY13 EPS). The chip equipment space has seen some bad earnings news (I, II) lately.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • SFL

    Ship Finance International (NYSE:SFL) declares $0.39/share quarterly dividend, in line with...

    Ship Finance International (NYSE:SFL) declares $0.39/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Forward yield 9.89%. For shareholders of record Sep 14. Payable Sep 28. Ex-div date Sep 12. Shares +4.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:24 AM
  • ESGR

    Insurance consultancy Enstar Group (NASDAQ:ESGR) agrees to acquire insurance holding company...

    Insurance consultancy Enstar Group (NASDAQ:ESGR) agrees to acquire insurance holding company SeaBright Holdings (NYSE:SBX) for ~$249M in cash, or $11.11/share, a 34% premium to SBX's Monday closing price. SBX +33.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM
  • SQNM

    Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM) +3.9% premarket on news its subsidiary has completed several...

    Sequenom (NASDAQ:SQNM) +3.9% premarket on news its subsidiary has completed several international distribution agreements that will expand access to the MaterniT21 PLUS testing service outside the U.S. MaterniT21 PLUS is intended for use in pregnant women at increased risk for fetal aneuploidy and can be used as early as 10 weeks gestation.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM

  • Market preview: Futures are flat-to-lower as the summer continues to meander on, devoid of much...

    Market preview: Futures are flat-to-lower as the summer continues to meander on, devoid of much of the drama of this time last year. Markets are killing time until Ben Bernanke speaks at Jackson Hole, hoping that he'll print more money, but they've been disappointed before. S&P Benchmark -0.1%. Later: Consumer Confidence, State Street Investor Confidence Index, Richmond Fed Mfg.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • SBX

    Premarket gainers: SBX +33%. MOV +15%. CYBX +9%. PVH +5%. MCP +5%. Losers: CPRX -22%.

    Premarket gainers: SBX +33%. MOV +15%. CYBX +9%. PVH +5%. MCP +5%.
    Losers: CPRX -22%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • CAL

    Shares of Brown Shoe (BWS) are on the move, up 4.4% premarket, after the company reports a...

    Shares of Brown Shoe (BWS) are on the move, up 4.4% premarket, after the company reports a better-than-forecast profit for Q2. On an earnings CC (webcast), execs keep a cautious tone while stressing the overall improvement in the company's cost controls and debt load.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • TELL

    Stratex Oil & Gas offers to purchase Magellan Petroleum (MPET) for ~$124M in cash and stock,...

    Stratex Oil & Gas offers to purchase Magellan Petroleum (MPET) for ~$124M in cash and stock, or $2.30/share, a 137% premium to MPET's Friday closing price. MPET +71.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM
  • BNS

    More on Scotiabank (NYSE:BNS): FQ3 income of $1.69 +54% Y/Y, assisted by the $0.53 gain from the...

    More on Scotiabank (NYSE:BNS): FQ3 income of $1.69 +54% Y/Y, assisted by the $0.53 gain from the sale of its headquarters. Backing that out yields a Y/Y gain of 5.5%. Dividend is hiked $0.02 to C$0.57/share. Shares +1.7% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM
  • BNS

    Bank of Nova Scotia (NYSE:BNS) declares $0.57/share quarterly dividend, 3.63% increase from...

    Bank of Nova Scotia (NYSE:BNS) declares $0.57/share quarterly dividend, 3.63% increase from prior dividend of $0.55. Forward yield 4.27%. For shareholders of record Oct 02. Payable Oct 29. Ex-div date Sep 28. Shares +2.3% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:20 AM
  • CAL

    More on Brown Shoe (BWS): Revenue at Famous Footwear up 1.6% to $350.3M. Gross margin increased...

    More on Brown Shoe (BWS): Revenue at Famous Footwear up 1.6% to $350.3M. Gross margin increased 140 bps to 39.0%, with SG&A expenses trending lower by 120 bps. Closed or relocated 26 stores and added 14 new stores during period. Adjusts its 2012 EPS outlook to $0.85-$0.95 vs. $0.83-$0.95 previous and $0.89 consensus. Shares +6.5% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:21 AM

  • European shares open down, maybe influenced by Japan's pessimism about its economy, and, so the...

    European shares open down, maybe influenced by Japan's pessimism about its economy, and, so the consensus goes, waiting for Ben Bernanke's speech at Jackson Hole. Euro Stoxx 50 -0.8%, London -0.2%, Paris -0.6%, Frankfurt -0.5%, Milan -0.6%, Madrid -0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 AM

  • It's the summer, people are on vacation and Asian investors, like their counterparts in other...

    It's the summer, people are on vacation and Asian investors, like their counterparts in other regions, are looking forward to Ben Bernanke at the end of the week. "People are waiting for Jackson Hole to confirm the wishful belief that (quantitative easing) could support risk assets," says Invesco's Paul Chan. Japan -0.6%, Hong Kong +0.1%, China +0.9%, India -0.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 AM | 1 Comment
